description: A very good example of Georgian/Adam architecture. Restoration 2012 of Great Room (James Barry paintings), Benjamin Franklin room. 2019, restoration and installation of 1754-2018 mural in the new Long Gallery.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: The Society for the encouragement of Arts, Manufactures and Commerce was founded in London by William Shipley in 1754.
The building was designed as part of the Adam brothers' Adelphi complex, the architect was Robert Adam and the foundation stones were laid in 1772.
Two time capsules were placed under the west and east foundation stones and the archive hold a record listing the enclosed items.

The House, as it is referred to was completed in 1774 and the Society (after 1908 'Royal') has been in residence, ever since. There are several original Adams features, including the cornice in the Great Room and 14 Adam fireplaces in the House.

factsheet.heading: London Open House
paragraphs: The RSA welcomes our visitors and offers:
•Robert Adam’s original plans of No 8 John Street, indentures, prints, letters, minutes etc.
•archive material relating to the 250th anniversary of laying foundation stones in 1772
•document of 1772 time capsule plus original medal that was buried in it
•a participatory activity to consider what would go in a time capsule of today

•Visit:
           Great Room and James Barry’s Paintings, started in 
           1772, completed in 1801

Benjamin Franklin Room and Troika chandelier 
            based on Franklin's design for a bi-focal lens

Atrium, previously the rear yard of the main building, 
            that includes the original flagstones and an award 
            winning staircase 
 
            The vaulted Durham Street Auditorium with the  
             original stone road and pavements incorporated into 
             the design
             
             The Vaults underpinning the building used as 
             warehousing and now as unique event spaces
         
             Follow the Library's journey from its first location in 
             the House to it's current home following the 2018 
             redevelopment

The Long Gallery with a full length 1754 –2018 
             mural, that chronicles the history of the RSA in the 
             style of the RSA Animates
•a wishing tree - add hopes and dreams for the future to regenerate people place and planet
•explore our eleven private hire event spaces
•coffee house open throughout the day, with light refreshments available to purchase

name: RSA (Royal Society for the encouragement of Arts, Manufactures and Commerce)
